tsinn.ui

Class BaseApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • tsinn.ui.BaseApp
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Example, SimpleApp

    public abstract class BaseApp
extends javafx.application.Application
    BaseApp is the abstract base class for all visual applications. All applications must subclass this class and then call launch on it. This class itself extends the JavaFX Application class.
    Author:
    Timothy Sinnott

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public abstract void setup(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        setup is a required method in all subclasses. This object will call this setup method when the application is first starting. It is expected that all needed initialization needs will be taken care of at that time.
        Parameters:
        gc - The GraphicsContext of the canvas being used to draw this application on.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts this application visually. This method will be called as a result of a call to this Application's launch method being called. Note that this class itself does not directly launch itself. It is expected that, for example, child classes will call launch as needed
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The primary stage used by this application. It is subsequently passed to the constructor of this objetc's BaseAppVisual.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Application.start(javafx.stage.Stage)

      • addDrawable

        public void addDrawable(Drawable drawableItem)
        Adds a Drawable item to this object's list of Drawable items. All known drawable items will then be asked to draw anytime this object is asked to draw itself.
        Parameters:
        drawableItem - The Drawable item to be added

      • addListener

        public void addListener(javafx.event.EventType et,
                        javafx.event.EventHandler<? super javafx.scene.input.InputEvent> listener)
        A generic way to add EventHandelers to this application. All events will be passed to this object's BaseAppVisual object via it's addEventHandler method
        Parameters:
        et - The EventType that is to be added. For Example, MouseEvent.MousePressed
        listener - The eventHandler that is listening for the actual event.

      • addAnimatable

        public void addAnimatable(Animatable animation)
        Adds an Animatable item to this object's list of Animatable items. All animatable items will then be updated every time this application updates. Note that the animate() method must be called in order to request that the application enable animation and thereby use these Animatable items.
        Parameters:
        animation - The item that is to be animated.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of this application's BaseAppVisual which is this application's canvas. Note that the size of the canvas will resize based on the window.
        Returns:
        The width of the Canvas that this application uses to draw on.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of this application's BaseAppVisual which is this application's canvas. Note that the size of the canvas will resize based on the window.
        Returns:
        The height of the Canvas that this application uses to draw on.

      • update

        public void update()
        Requests that this application updates. This will result in this application's BaseAppVisual draw method being called

      • animate

        public void animate()
        Requests that this application began animating. This will kick off an AnimationTimer which will regularly call all of this object's Animatable objects

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String audioFileName)
        A convenience method for playing an audio file based on the name of the audio file to be played. This method chains to playSound(Media, Duration, Duration) Where the duration if from 0 to the end of the specified audio file.
        Parameters:
        audioFileName - The name of the audio file to be played. It is used to create a new javafx.scene.media.Media object

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String audioFileName,
                      double fromMillis,
                      double toMillis)
        A convenience method for playing sections of an audio file This method chains to playSound(Media, Duration, Duration)
        Parameters:
        audioFileName - The name of the audio file to be played
        fromMillis - The time in milliseconds that the audio should start at
        toMillis - The time in milliseconds that the audio should end at.

      • playSound

        public void playSound(javafx.scene.media.Media med,
                      javafx.util.Duration fromMillis,
                      javafx.util.Duration toMillis)
        Played the specified Media object from the specified start position to the specified stop position
        Parameters:
        med - The Media object to be played
        fromMillis - The position (in milliseconds) that the Media object's playback should begin
        toMillis - The position (in milliseconds) that the Media object's playback should stop

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
